description: Preview Current Line - Temporarily reveal cloaked values on current line for editing

userStories.title: Add CloakPreviewLine command
userStories.description: As a user, I want a command to reveal the cloaked value on my current line so that I can see and edit it.
acceptanceCriteria: :CloakPreviewLine command reveals cloaked content on current line
Command only works when cursor is on a line with cloaked content
Revealed text shows actual value inline (replaces cloak characters)
M.preview_line() Lua function available for keymaps
Returns early with no error if line has no cloak
make lint passes
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Auto-recloak on insert mode exit
userStories.description: As a user, I want the line to automatically re-cloak when I leave insert mode so that secrets aren't left exposed.
acceptanceCriteria: Exiting insert mode (Escape, Ctrl-C, etc.) re-cloaks the revealed line
Re-cloaking happens immediately without user action
Works for all insert mode exit methods
InsertLeave autocmd is buffer-local when preview is active
Autocmd cleaned up when re-cloaking
make lint passes
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Add CloakPreviewToggle for normal mode
userStories.description: As a user, I want a toggle command that works in normal mode so I can preview without entering insert mode.
acceptanceCriteria: :CloakPreviewToggle command toggles reveal state on current line
First call reveals, second call re-cloaks
Works in normal mode (no insert mode requirement)
M.preview_toggle() Lua function available for keymaps
Re-cloak previous line if called on different line
Clear preview state on BufLeave or BufWinLeave
make lint passes
Typecheck passes

userStories.title: Document preview feature
userStories.description: As a user, I want documentation so I know how to use the preview feature.
acceptanceCriteria: Add :help tiny-cloak-preview section to doc/tiny-cloak.nvim.txt
README updated with preview usage example
Example keymap provided (no default keymap shipped)
